Master Answer: After receiving the Measles, Mumps, Rubella (MMR) Vaccine there are not recommendations related to alcohol or smoking and increased risk of reactions. Common reactions to the MMR vaccine may include soreness, redness and swelling where the vaccine was given. A mild fever, a rash that looks like measles and swelling of glands in the cheeks or neck can occur about 7 to 12 days after getting the vaccine. Temporary joint pain may occur in teenage and adult women. Read more about measles and the vaccine here.
Master Question: Is there any side effect or any problem about alcohol or smoking after when we get measle vaccination?
